intro: Sonnea glomerata, commonly known as the clustered sonnea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Its flowers are often pale pink or white, and it produces small, hard seeds that are dispersed by wind. Sonnea glomerata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
